intellectualRights.para: NEON Data Usage and Citation Policy
Copyright Â© 2016 National Ecological Observatory Network

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person or organization obtaining a copy of the NEON Observatory data products, associated software and accompanying documentation covered by this license (the "NEON Data Products") to use, reproduce, display, distribute, publish, execute, and transmit the NEON Data Products, and to prepare derivative works of the NEON Data Products, and to permit third-parties to whom the NEON Data Products are furnished to do so, all subject to the following:

The copyright notices in the NEON Data Products and this entire statement, including the above copyright statement, license grant, this restriction and the following disclaimer, must be included in all copies of the NEON Data Products, in whole or in part, and all derivative works of the Data Products.

The NEON data products are provided "as is", without warranty of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title and non-infringement. In no event shall the copyright holders or anyone distributing the neon data products be liable for any damages or other liability, whether in contract, tort or otherwise, arising from, out of or in connection with the NEON data products.

dataset.purpose: Individual- and trap-level data collected using box traps designed to capture small mammals

description.para: These data are available via the NEON Data Portal (http://data.neonscience.org).

abstract.para: The National Ecological Observatory Network is a project sponsored by the National Science Foundation.

NEON's mission is to design, implement, and operate continental-scale research infrastructure to open new horizons in ecological science and education, and to enable ecological analyses and forecasts for the benefit of society.

citation.title: "2011 Science Strategy: Enabling Continental-Scale Ecological Forecasting"
citation.intellectualRights: Copyright 2011 NEON, Inc. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

attribute.attributeDefinition: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, WGS84) of the geographic center of the reference area
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, WGS84) of the geographic center of the reference area
Model used to measure horizontal position on the earth

textDomain.definition: Model used to measure horizontal position on the earth

attribute.attributeDefinition: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Zero is not a valid value for this term
Elevation (in meters) above sea level
Uncertainty in elevation values (in meters)

Categorical descriptor of trap status; 0 - no data; 1 - trap not set; 2 - trap disturbed/door closed but empty; 3 - trap door open or closed w/ spoor left; 4 - >1 capture in one trap; 5 - capture; 6 - trap set and empty

codeDefinition.code: 4 - more than 1 capture in one trap
3 - trap door open or closed w/ spoor left

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type of trap from which a sample was collected
Date of the collection event
The end date-time or interval during which an event occurred

textDomain.definition: Barcode of an individual

attribute.attributeDefinition: Species code, based on one or more sources

textDomain.definition: Species code, based on one or more sources

attribute.attributeDefinition: Scientific name, associated with the taxonID. This is the name of the lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined

textDomain.definition: Scientific name, associated with the taxonID. This is the name of the lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined

attribute.attributeDefinition: The lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined for the individual or specimen

textDomain.definition: The lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined for the individual or specimen

attribute.attributeDefinition: A standard term to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification

codeDefinition.definition: AG - similar to but is not the genus
CF - roughly equals but 'not sure' about the family
CV - roughly equals but 'not sure' about the variety
AS - similar to but is not the species
AV - similar to but is not the variety
CG - roughly equals but 'not sure' about the genus
CB - roughly equals but 'not sure' about the subspecies
AF - similar to but is not the family
AB - similar to but is not the subspecies
CS - roughly equals but 'not sure' about the species

attribute.attributeDefinition: A list of sources (concatenated and semicolon separated) used to derive the specific taxon concept; including field guide editions, books, or versions of NEON keys used

codeDefinition.code: Kaufman, K., R. Bowers, and N. Bowers. 2007. Kaufman Field Guide to Mammals of North America. 12th Ed. Houghton Mifflin Company, New York, NY.
codeDefinition.definition: Kaufman, K., R. Bowers, and N. Bowers. 2007. Kaufman Field Guide to Mammals of North America. 12th Ed. Houghton Mifflin Company, New York, NY.

codeDefinition.code: Best, T. L., and J. L. Dusi. 2014. Mammals of Alabama. The University of Alabama Press, Tuscaloosa.
codeDefinition.definition: Best, T. L., and J. L. Dusi. 2014. Mammals of Alabama. The University of Alabama Press, Tuscaloosa.

codeDefinition.code: Reid, F. 2006. A field guide to mammals of North America, north of Mexico. 4th ed. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston.
codeDefinition.definition: Reid, F. 2006. A field guide to mammals of North America, north of Mexico. 4th ed. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The process by which the taxon became established in the location
M for male, F for female, U for unknown
Indicates whether or not the captured individual is a recapture; 'Y' for yes, 'N' for no

The fate of the individual, unless marked and released; 'dead' = dead, 'escaped' = escaped while handling, 'nontarget' = released, non-target species, 'released' = target or opportunistic species released without full processing
Indicates which ear tag was replaced (L#### | R####) or which ear appears to have lost a tag ('left' = left ear tag replaced; 'right' = right ear tag replaced)

textDomain.definition: Indicates which ear tag was replaced (L#### | R####) or which ear appears to have lost a tag ('left' = left ear tag replaced; 'right' = right ear tag replaced)

attribute.attributeDefinition: The age class of the individual at the time the Occurrence was recorded. juvenile = obvious signs of a very young individual, small size, distinctive pelage coloration; subabult; adult
Condition of the testes at time of capture; if mature: scrotal = testes descended, nonscrotal = testes abdominal
Condition of the nipples at time of capture; if mature: enlarged = nipples enlarged, nonenlarged = nipples not enlarged
Condition at time of capture; if mature: 'pregnant' | 'not'
Condition of the vagina at time of capture; if mature: swollen, plugged, neither
length of left hindfoot; including claws; in millimeters
length of left ear; in millimeters
length of tail; in millimeters
total length (head + body); in millimeters
Live weight as measured with a spring scale; in grams
Indicates whether larval ticks are observed on the captured individual
Indicates whether nymphal ticks are observed on the captured individual
Indicates whether adult ticks are observed on the captured individual
